item.description:
Let's try Good Times Restaurant/Pub in Cumberland for June's brunch.

This is a brunch buffet. $9.00 per person (Rather inexpensive)

A member of our group suggested this restaurant. I've never eaten here but the reviews on Google say the food is good.

Here's their menu:

Good Times Elite Sunday Breakfast Buffet

Served 9:00 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. $8.99 per Guest

- Grilled Pit Ham
- Breakfast Sausage
- Southern Sausage Gravy over Biscuits
- Crisp Bacon
- Hash of the Day
- Eggs Benedict of the Day
- Scrambled Eggs Plain or with assorted meats, vegetables and cheeses
- Texas French Toast & Pancakes
- Fresh Strawberries & Whipped Cream
- Home Fried Red Bliss Potatoes
- Baked Beans and Fish Cakes
- Yogurt & Fresh Seasonal Fruit
- Freshly Baked Mini Muffins
- Assorted Mini Danish. Also White, Wheat, Rye, Raisin Toast, English Muffins or Bagel w/ cream cheese upon request

Eggs Cooked to Order Featuring:

Eggs Benedict - With ham, cheese and poached eggs
Texas Eggs - With hash and poached eggs
Florentine Eggs - With spinach, tomato, garlic and cheese, served with hollandaise sauce

Omelets Cooked to Order with Your Choice of:

Tomato, Bacon, Sausage, Ham, Peppers, Onions, Spinach, Mushrooms, Scallions, Mozzarella, Swiss, Cheddar or American Cheese

Add any of These Specialty Omelets to Your Buffet $.99

Bacon Cheeseburger
Spinach, mushrooms, scalllions and Havarti cheese
Bacon, tomato, onion, mushroom and gorgonzola cheese
Philly steak, mushroom, peppers, onion and 3 cheeses
Buffalo chicken, onion and 3 cheeses

Add:
3/4 lb. choice sirloin to your breakfast buffet....$7.99
1/2 lb. Steak Tips....$4.99
London Broil with Mushroom Demi Glace....$4.99
Twin 4 oz. Grilled BBQ Center Cut Pork Chops....$4.99

Here's a website to check them out

http://www.goodtimesr...
item.name: June Brunch - Good Times Restaurant/Pub (Cumberland)
